nodes.bodyText:
I suggest to add examples.
They will help to understand why we have antipattern and the will be useful for regression testing, since running LT tests will check that the example sentence don't trigger error with the current rule.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8193,18 +8193,41 @@ though, and has since been slightly modified)-->
       </rule>
     </rulegroup>
     <rulegroup id="ACCORD_NOMBRE" name="Accord en nombre">
+    <antipattern>
+        <token regexp="yes">\d+</token>
+        <token regexp="yes">heures?</token>
+        <token regexp="yes">\d+</token>
+    </antipattern>
+    <antipattern>
+        <token regexp="yes">formule|saisons?|épisodes?|zones?</token>
+        <token regexp="yes">\d+</token>
+    </antipattern>
+    <antipattern>
+        <token regexp="yes">\d+</token>
+        <token regexp="yes">éditions</token>
+    </antipattern>
+    <antipattern>
+        <token regexp="yes">Windows|Apple|Galaxy</token>
+        <token regexp="yes">\d+</token>
+        <token postag=".*s"/>
+    </antipattern>

nodes.bodyText: Understood, I'll remember to add examples in the future, I'll add one for this immediately.
